channel.title: Xbootclasspath help
channel.description:
So I'm using xbootclasspath to add listeners to things such as sound and packets in java api. Now the problem is that the xbooted classes cannot use the regular classes (not xbooted ones) so I end up adding a lot of stuff in xbootclasspath. For example I need to add the listener classes, event classes ... pretty much end up adding the whole bot.
Is there a way around this?

item.title: Xbootclasspath help
item.dc:creator: @antti_mies antti mies
item.description:
@antti_mies wrote:

Thanks for your replies. I’m just annoyed by the fact that I end up xbooting almost every class because xbooted classes can’t “see” the not xbooted classes (couldn’t for example extend a not xbooted class). I guess it doesn’t matter if my whole bot is xbooted.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbootclasspath help
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

you can still Xbootclasspath but just make the original extend the hacked class such as javax.sound.midi.Sequence extends HackedSequence. I still don’t fully understand what you are asking though

Read full topic

item.title: Xbootclasspath help
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

You’d have to manipulate the actual classes directly, I’m sure. Da fuck do I know.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbootclasspath help
item.dc:creator: @antti_mies antti mies
item.description:
@antti_mies wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:2, topic:442217”]By not using xbootclasspath?[/quote]What method(s) would you recommend to accomplish that? If I used like bytecode injection (which I don’t know how to) wouldn’t I have to crack the inner pack etc? Or injecting bytecode to the java api classes?

Read full topic

item.title: Xbootclasspath help
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

By not using xbootclasspath?

Read full topic
